0.title: He'll lose Wayanad too: Owaisi on Rahul's challenge to AIMIM, TRS
0.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has challenged Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to contest from Hyderabad and Medak in next year's Telangana Assembly elections. He said, "I'm saying...(Rahul) will now lose from Wayanad too. Come, contest from Hyderabad. Try your luck. You can contest from Medak too." This comes after Gandhi, on Friday, said he'll challenge TRS, BJP and AIMIM in Telangana.

1.title: BJP doesn't want Congress to completely disappear: Union Minister HS Puri
1.article_body: The BJP doesn't want Congress to "completely disappear", Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said, adding, "We need an opposition." Puri said, "If we have an opposition then the opposition has to decide whether it wants to be led by Rahul Gandhi, Mamata Banerjee, Arvind Kejriwal or Sharad Pawar." The opposition needs to "get its act together", he added.

2.title: Police mustn't be used to settle political scores: Congress' Hooda
2.article_body: Criticising the Centre and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) over BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's arrest, Congress leader Deepender Hooda said, "Police should not be used to settle political scores." He added, "The police of three states were involved. There should be tolerance." A similar case happened with Jignesh Mevani in Assam, he added.

3.title: My biggest shortcoming is 'basic shot-making': SS Rajamouli
3.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli in an interview has revealed that his biggest shortcoming is "basic shot-making" since he has not worked as an assistant director on any film. "When I made my first film 'Student No.1', I didn't know how to use a crane...I still don't know what shot exactly gives me what I need," the filmmaker added.

4.title: Rare case of monkeypox detected in UK, govt lists symptoms
4.article_body: An individual, who has recent travel history from Nigeria, has been diagnosed with monkeypox in England, said the UK government. The rare viral infection can spread when someone is in close contact with an infected person; however, there's very low risk of transmission to general population. Initial symptoms include fever, headache, muscle aches, swollen lymph nodes, chills and exhaustion.

5.title: Delhi reports 1,407 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths; positivity rate at 4.72%
5.article_body: Delhi on Saturday reported 1,407 new cases of COVID-19 and two deaths in the last 24 hours. The national capital witnessed a slight dip in the daily positivity rate, which stood at 4.72% on Saturday, compared to 5.39% on Friday. The city reported 1,546 recoveries, while 4,365 patients are under home isolation.

6.title: US First Lady Jill Biden meets Ukrainian refugees in Romania
6.article_body: During a visit to Romania on Saturday, US First Lady Jill Biden met Ukrainian women and children who had fled the war in Ukraine. She praised the Romanian government and relief organisations for the humanitarian aid they are providing to refugees. Notably, over 9 lakh Ukrainians have fled to Romania since Russia launched its invasion.

7.title: Loudspeaker issue is over in Maharashtra: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut
7.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra was over. He said, "There is peace in Maharashtra, some people were trying to spoil the situation in the state but they have been given a befitting reply." He also called upon the Centre for a policy on the usage of loudspeakers for the entire country.

8.title: Train services between Bihar's Kosi & Mithila resume after 88 yrs
8.article_body: Train services between Bihar's Kosi and Mithila, which had stopped following the 1934 earthquake, have been restored after 88 years with the launch of a passenger train between Jhanjharpur and Nirmali. The train was virtually flagged off by Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Saturday. The train services will reduce the distance between Jhanjharpur to Saharsa by about 100 km.

9.title: KL Rahul gets out for diamond duck, IPL share video
9.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul was dismissed for a diamond duck on the fifth delivery of the first over against KKR on Saturday. Rahul got run out for 0(0) after a direct hit by KKR captain Shreyas Iyer. Rahul was sent back to the non-striker's end by Quinton De Kock who initially set off for a quick single.

10.title: Woman robbed of jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh in Maha by 4 posing as policemen
10.article_body: Four unidentified persons allegedly robbed a 60-year-old woman of her jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh in Maharashtra. The victim was travelling in an autorickshaw when the accused riding sports bikes intercepted her and flashed a fake identity card, posing as police personnel. The accused allegedly asked her to keep her jewellery safely in a packet and offered to help her pack.

11.title: Man dies after TN bar server beats him for throwing food on floor
11.article_body: A 35-year-old man died after a Tasmac bar attendant allegedly beat him following a quarrel about throwing food on the bar's floor in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Thursday. The victim "fainted and fell on the floor" after the incident and was taken to hospital for treatment, police said. He was then dropped at his house but he, however, died later.

12.title: BJP-RSS trying to rekindle 90s' era of hatred: Owaisi on Gyanvapi mosque survey
12.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday criticised a Varanasi court's order allowing survey of some sections of Gyanvapi mosque. Owaisi also accused the BJP-RSS of rekindling "the era of hatred as the one in the 90s". "This order to survey the masjid is an open violation of Places of Worship Act 1991, which prohibits conversion of religious places," Owaisi added.

13.title: Never a choice, I admire her holistically: Palak on her standing by mom Shweta
13.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari, speaking about standing by her mother actress Shweta Tiwari's side, stated that it was never a choice. She said that the only person she's admired holistically is her mother, adding she always prioritised the well-being of their family. "For me, she could do no wrong then and she could do no wrong now," Palak said.

14.title: It breaks my heart: Depp's ex-fiancee amid defamation trial with Heard
14.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-fiancee Jennifer Grey has spoken about his ongoing defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, saying it breaks her heart "for everybody involved". Jennifer added, "I just think it's sad and I wish it was resolved and I just wish everybody well." Depp has sued Heard following her 2018 op-ed piece about being a victim of domestic violence.

15.title: 25,000 litres of chemical used to make spurious liquor seized in MP
15.article_body: A tanker filled with around 25,000 litres of overproof chemical, which is commonly used for preparing spurious liquor, was seized from a warehouse in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday. The chemical is reportedly worth around ₹5 crore. Police have booked two people associated with the inter-state liquor peddler group under provisions of Excise Act.

16.title: 3 Goa I-T officers sexually assault & threaten woman staff, booked
16.article_body: Three Income Tax inspectors in Goa's Panaji, who allegedly sexually assaulted a female staff, have been booked, police said, adding, they are yet to be arrested. Two of them had also threatened the victim to delete WhatsApp messages while the third outraged her modesty, police added. Police are investigating further and have sought CCTV footage from the Income Tax office.

17.title: 4 cheat MP villagers of ₹5 lakh using biometric machines, arrested
17.article_body: Cyber police in MP have arrested four persons for cheating over 30 villagers of ₹5 lakh using biometric machines. According to police, the gang's kingpin organised camps to prepare Ayushman cards, etc, and the accused helped villagers in opening bank accounts. They, however, stored their digital information in an application and later used it to siphon money from villagers' accounts.

18.title: Who is IAS officer Pooja Singhal, being investigated in ₹18 cr fraud in J'khand?
18.article_body: Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal is being investigated by ED in a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. The 2000 batch IAS officer had reportedly cleared UPSC at 21 and was the Agriculture Secretary in the previous BJP government. She's been accused of financial irregularities during her tenure as Deputy Commissioner of three different districts.

19.title: 2 workers killed, 3 injured in accident at Tidong Hydropower Project in Himachal
19.article_body: Two workers died and three others sustained injuries in a major accident at Tidong Hydropower Project in Himachal Pradesh's Kinnaur on Saturday morning. As per information, the five workers were travelling in a trolley inside the tunnel when it reportedly slipped off from the track and fell deep inside. ITBP personnel rescued the three injured workers trapped inside the tunnel.

20.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature today released
20.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of cities that recorded 42°C or more as their maximum temperature on Saturday. Rajasthan's Barmer recorded the highest maximum temperature at 45°C, followed by Phalodi (44.6°C). Both Bikaner and Maharashtra's Jalgaon recorded maximum temperature of 44.5°C. A maximum temperature of 44.4°C was recorded in Jaisalmer.

21.title: Diplomats express concern over state of emergency in Sri Lanka
21.article_body: Diplomats and rights groups on Saturday raised their concerns over a state of emergency imposed by Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa in the country. Under the emergency regulations, Rajapaksa can authorise detentions, seize possession of property and search any premises. Notably, this comes after protests erupted against him over the handling of the economic crisis in the country.

22.title: RR record their first successful chase in IPL 2022, end their 2-match losing streak
22.article_body: RR chased down the target of 190 runs in 19.4 overs against PBKS to record their first successful run chase in IPL 2022. With the victory, RR ended their two-match losing streak. Yashasvi Jaiswal top-scored for RR with 68(41), while their leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal registered bowling figures of 4-0-28-3.

23.title: Bag maker ESBEDA fined ₹38,000 for charging customer ₹20 for its carry bag in Mumbai
23.article_body: A Mumbai District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has fined bag maker ESBEDA for charging a customer ₹20 for its carry bag in 2019, which was branded with the company's logo. The commission asked the company to pay the customer ₹13,000 towards litigation expenses and compensation. Moreover, it was asked to deposit ₹25,000 with the consumer welfare fund.

24.title: Anonymity is an 'inherent risk' in use of blockchain tech: FM Sitharaman
24.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said anonymity is an "inherent risk" in use of blockchain technology and urged people to take precaution in future with a rise in the use of this technology. Calling distributed ledger technology (DLT) "beautiful", she added, "Unless we...guard ourselves against that anonymous element...we'll be exposing ourselves much more than...we would've imagined."

25.title: 'Got a call saying I'm laid off,' says woman days before she was due to join Meta
25.article_body: In a widely-shared LinkedIn post, Stephanie Washington, who was hired as a Recruiting Coordinator for Meta, said she was laid off just days before she was due to join the workplace. "I just signed...apartment lease 15 minutes before my manager called me...They are only compensating us for six weeks of pay after a month-long process of interviews," she wrote.

26.title: Railway staff risks life to restart train on bridge as passenger pulls alarm chain
26.article_body: Railways Ministry shared a video of an employee risking his life to restart a train that was halted over a river bridge after a passenger pulled the alarm chain. The video shows Central Railways' Assistant Loco Pilot Satish Kumar resetting Godan Express' alarm chain by going under it. "Pulling the...chain for no reason can cause trouble to many," said Railways.

27.title: Govt aims to set up vehicle scrapyards within 150 kms of city centres
27.article_body: The government aims to develop at least one automobile scrapping facility within 150 kilometres of each city centre, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Saturday. India has the potential to become vehicle scrapping hub of South Asia, Gadkari added. The National Automobile Scrappage Policy allows all types and sizes of investors to come and establish scrapping centres, he further said.

28.title: KKR to bowl first against LSG, both teams make one change each
28.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG. Both the sides have made one change each. Harshit Rana has replaced Umesh Yadav in KKR's playing XI, while Avesh Khan has replaced Krishnappa Gowtham in LSG's playing XI. LSG are currently second on the IPL 2022 points table, while KKR are placed eighth.

29.title: 5 dead, 1 critical as vehicle crashes into truck from behind in Maharashtra
29.article_body: Five persons were killed, while a two-year-old girl had a miraculous escape, when a speeding multi-utility vehicle rammed into a truck from behind in Maharashtra, a police officer said. Another person was left critically injured in the incident, the officer added. The accident took place when the vehicle was on its way towards Nagpur from Umred.

30.title: I wasn't treated properly, didn't get the respect I deserved: Chris Gayle on snubbing IPL
30.article_body: Talking about not giving his name for IPL mega auction earlier this year, Chris Gayle said, "For the last couple of years...the way the IPL went about, I felt...I wasn't treated properly." He added he didn't get the respect he deserved after doing "so much" for the sport and IPL. Notably, Gayle had pulled out of IPL 2021 mid-way.

31.title: Mumbai chicken delivery boy arrested for molesting 3 persons, including minor girl
31.article_body: Police, while questioning a 24-year-old youth arrested in a molestation case, found that two previous cases of molestation were registered against him, including one involving a minor girl. In one case, the accused, a Mumbai-based chicken delivery boy, had reportedly tried to enter the complainant's house after delivering chicken and kept staring at her and tried to open her door.

32.title: Sex racket running through secret door in toilet busted in K'taka; woman seen coming out
32.article_body: A prostitution racket which was running through a small secret door inside a toilet has been busted, with Chitradurga police arresting three people in Karnataka. The accused used the secret door to let in the "customers", according to reports. A video has also surfaced showing a woman coming out of the door.

33.title: John Mulaney told me to spread 'Kanye has polio' rumours: Pete
33.article_body: Comedian Pete Davidson has revealed that John Mulaney told him to spread the rumour that his girlfriend Kim Kardashian's ex-husband rapper Kanye West has polio. As per reports, Kanye had spread rumours in January that Pete is a gay man who contracted AIDS. "AIDS is such an old-school-like thing...It's just such a '90s, early 2000s thing to [come at me]."

34.title: Dave Chappelle getting a** whipped needed to happen: Kevin Hart
34.article_body: Comedian Kevin has reacted to comedian Dave Chappelle being attacked onstage during his show, saying that it "needed to happen". "Somebody getting their ass whipped sends a message out to the other people," Kevin added. He further said that there are "a lot of lines that have gotten blurred" and people shouldn't continue to think they can "break the barrier".

35.title: I was 110kg & wanted to act, relatives said someone did witchcraft: Manoj
35.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has revealed that ahead of his acting debut, his relatives said "someone has done some kind of witchcraft" on him as he was "110 kg overweight and [wants] to become a hero". Manoj further said that he was labelled a comedian and "got frustrated" with the film roles he was offered before 'Article 15' and 'Mulk'.

36.title: Rare tornado witnessed in Assam, video goes viral
36.article_body: A low-intensity tornado was captured in videos in a village in Assam's Barpeta on Saturday. The tornado, a rare occurrence in these parts, is seen tearing through a field and some huts in the video. Locals said they saw a clear swirling column of air carrying dust and debris. There were no immediate reports of loss of life or property.

37.title: CBI searches premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant in ₹40 crore bank fraud case
37.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is carrying out searches at the premises of AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra in an alleged ₹40 crore bank fraud case, officials said on Saturday. The searches are being conducted at three locations in Sangrur, including the Malerkotla area, which is the ancestral home of the Amargarh MLA, officials added.

38.title: Punjab court issues fresh arrest warrant against BJP's Bagga a day after release
38.article_body: A Mohali court on Saturday issued fresh warrants for BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's arrest, a day after he was released from Punjab Police's custody and brought back to Delhi. The court instructed the police to produce Bagga before it. Bagga was arrested on Friday for allegedly making provocative statements and 'threatening' AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal during a protest.

39.title: Supreme Court gets 2 more judges, set to regain full strength of 34
39.article_body: The Supreme Court is set to regain its full strength of 34 judges with two appointments to the top court on Saturday. The Union Law Ministry announced Gauhati High Court Chief Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia and Gujarat High Court Justice JB Pardiwala's appointments in separate notifications. This comes days after the Supreme Court Collegium recommended the names for elevation to SC.

40.title: Pic of notice on separate lift for 'house maids' in Pune society sparks debate
40.article_body: A notice asking domestic helps and service personnel to use only the lift assigned to them in a Pune housing society has sparked a debate on Twitter. "It's less about the so-called maintenance, it's more about the 'mental comfort' of the orthodox residents," a user said. Some people argued that separate lift was assigned because workers stopped on every floor.

41.title: ₹2.65 lakh cr spent on projects in Northeast from 2014-2021: Govt
41.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Friday said that more than ₹2.65 lakh crore had been spent on various infrastructure projects in the Northeast from 2014 to 2021. "The result of which is visible in...form of development," he added. Separately, Rai also said that there's been a vast improvement in the security situation in the Northeast.

42.title: KT Rama Rao reviews Hyderabad civic body's development projects
42.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao reviewed development projects undertaken by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) and other departments and advised authorities to complete the monsoon season plan. Officials said that the minister took stock of the progress of the construction of link roads in Hyderabad, the strategic canal development programme and the construction of Hyderabad roads.

43.title: Police raid gambling den in Hyderabad, 9 arrested
43.article_body: The Rachakonda Police said that nine people have been arrested on charges of gambling. Playing cards and cash were also seized from the accused, the police said. "The LB Nagar Police nabbed Gaming Act offenders, seized one cell phone, 27 playing cards, and net cash of ₹7,980," Rachakonda Police added.

44.title: We don't support murderers: Owaisi on murder of man by wife's relatives in Hyd
44.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has condemned the killing of 25-year-old Hindu man Nagaraju, who was allegedly lynched by his Muslim wife's relatives over their marriage on a busy road in Hyderabad. Owaisi added that the woman had married willingly and her family had no right to kill her husband. "We do not support murderers," Owaisi further said.

45.title: Baseless and untrue: ED as Xiaomi alleges it threatened staff with 'violence'
45.article_body: After Xiaomi alleged in a court filing that its top executives faced threats of "physical violence" during a probe by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), the agency responded saying that the claims are "untrue and baseless". The ED said that "there was no coercion or threat to the officers of the company" and that they deposed their statements before ED voluntarily.

46.title: Aditi Rao Hydari to make her debut at 75th Cannes Film Festival
46.article_body: Aditi Rao Hydari will be making her debut at the 75th Cannes Film Festival this year. The actress will be representing smartphone brand Vivo India at the festival. "As an artist, being a part of a prestigious institution that celebrates cinema is an exhilarating feeling," Aditi said. Notably, Deepika Padukone will also attend the festival as a jury member.

47.title: Abhishek in talks for John's 'Ayyappanum...' remake after Arjun's exit: Report
47.article_body: Arjun Kapoor has reportedly opted out of the Hindi remake of the Malayalam film 'Ayyappanum Koshiyum'. Abhishek Bachchan, who had earlier stepped away from the film, is in advanced talks with the makers to portray Prithviraj Sukumaran's character Koshi Kurian in the remake, as per the report. The upcoming film will be directed by 'Mission Mangal' director Jagan Shakti.

48.title: Rahul Gandhi meets jailed NSUI students in Hyderabad
48.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi met 18 NSUI members in Hyderabad's Chanchalguda Central Jail who were detained for protesting against Osmania University's administration for not giving permission for Gandhi's event on the campus. Gandhi, who is on a two-day visit to Telangana, tweeted, "The soul of the Congress is its dedicated workers, who are waging a selfless battle against injustice."

49.title: Emmanuel Macron sworn in as French President for second term
49.article_body: Emmanuel Macron was on Saturday sworn in as President of France for a second term at a ceremony at the Elysee Palace, followed by the firing of canons at the Invalides gardens. Macron said his second term would be "new" and not merely a continuation of the first. Macron had defeated far-right rival Marine Le Pen to win the election.

50.title: Harry, Meghan will not appear on palace balcony during Queen's Jubilee
50.article_body: UK's Prince Harry, his wife Meghan Markle and Prince Andrew will not appear on the Buckingham Palace balcony as part of the opening celebrations for Queen Elizabeth II's Platinum Jubilee. The Queen will be joined on June 2 only by "members of...Royal Family who're currently undertaking official public duties", Buckingham Palace said, adding the decision was taken after "careful consideration".

51.title: Has he vanished into thin air?: SC to UP on missing 82-yr-old COVID-19 patient
51.article_body: The Supreme Court has criticised the Uttar Pradesh Police and state government over their inability to trace an 82-year-old COVID-19 patient, who went missing from a hospital in Prayagraj over a year ago. "How can a person, who was finding it difficult to walk, vanish into thin air?" the SC observed. The matter will now be heard after four weeks.

52.title: Took a while for me to get comfortable in my own skin: Samantha
52.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu stated that it took her a while to get comfortable in her own skin and now, she is much more confident in trying out different roles which she wouldn't have had the courage to do in past. "I believe after working on so many projects, I can say that I'm a lot more confident," Samantha said.

53.title: Kashyap's daughter reveals her Instagram account was hacked, says 'so scary'
53.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap's daughter and YouTuber Aaliyah Kashyap took to Instagram Stories on Saturday to inform her fans and followers that her account was hacked. "My account was hacked. So scary I want to die," she wrote. "Please ignore whatever was posted or if you got any messages or anything weird," Aaliyah added.

54.title: Dhawan's an IPL legend, not discussed as much as other players: Harbhajan
54.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan is not discussed as much as other players, with some players given "too much" attention. "Dhawan is an IPL legend. He has scored runs against all the opposition and proved himself," added Harbhajan. "Dhawan deserves praise as he has scored over 6,000 runs in IPL," stated Harbhajan.

55.title: Babar is better than Kohli, Shaheen better than Bumrah: Aaqib Javed
55.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed has said that Pakistan skipper Babar Azam is better than Virat Kohli while pacer Shaheen Afridi is better than India's Jasprit Bumrah. "Now I think Babar is ahead. He [Kohli] had his peak but now going down," Javed said. "I now think that Shaheen is better than Bumrah...(He) has more capacity than Bumrah," Javed added.

56.title: Andhra HC sentences 3 IAS officers to 1 month of jail for contempt of court
56.article_body: Andhra Pradesh High Court on Friday sentenced three IAS officers to one month of jail for contempt of court. In October 2019, the court had directed the officials to consider and pass an order on the candidature of a petitioner to the post of Village Agriculture Assistant (Grade-2) within two weeks, which the officers failed to implement.

57.title: Odisha puts 175 fire units on high alert, cancels officers' leaves ahead of cyclone
57.article_body: In view of a cyclonic storm over east-central Bay of Bengal by May 8, the Odisha government has put 175 fire units on high alert and also cancelled leaves of officers. Odisha Fire Services Director General SK Upadhyay has informed that the southern districts are more vulnerable to the storm, which is expected to hit the state on May 10.

58.title: Fake notice saying NEET PG 2022 postponed posted online, no delay in exam: Govt
58.article_body: The Centre has warned about a fake notice claiming that the NEET PG 2022 exam has been postponed to July 9, saying, "The exam hasn't been postponed." It added, "It will be conducted on 21 May only...Don't be misled by such unverified notices." The fake notice was issued in the name of National Board of Examinations.

59.title: Amazon driver leaves 'kind' message for girl fighting cancer in US, Bezos reacts
59.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos took to Instagram Stories to share the story of Amazon driver Asani Anderson who left a message for an 8-year-old girl battling cancer in US while dropping off packages. "Amazon is praying 4 Aubrey luv you!" the message by Anderson read. Reacting to the gesture, Bezos wrote on Instagram, "Kindness makes our world better...Anderson embodies it."

60.title: UP minister bathes with hand pump water at supporter's home, says 'No VIP culture'
60.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Nand Gopal Gupta 'Nandi' posted a video of himself bathing in hand pump water after staying the night at a party worker's home. "This is the difference between...Yogi government and previous governments. In Yogi Sarkar, there's no distance and difference between the common man and the government," he tweeted. "There is no VIP culture," he added.

61.title: They want to see a crying widow: Neetu on being trolled post Rishi's death
61.article_body: Neetu Kapoor, in an interview, opened up on getting trolled for being more active on social media after Rishi Kapoor's demise. Neetu said, "There are some who say things like 'her husband is dead and she is enjoying'. They want to see that crying widow type." "I just block them," she said, adding there is nothing wrong with being happy.

62.title: Brisbane Olympics 2032 is a big event for whole Pacific region: IOC Prez
62.article_body: International Olympic Committee President Thomas Bach has said that the Brisbane Olympics 2032 is a big event for the "whole Pacific region". "I can say because I have been travelling in the meantime in the Pacific," Bach said. "But what is important...it's everywhere, it's great anticipation of these (Olympic) Games. They are all excited, they are all motivated," Bach added.

63.title: Apple China plant workers clash with guards over COVID-19 lockdowns
63.article_body: Hundreds of Apple Shanghai plant workers clashed with guards on Thursday after weeks at the plant under COVID-19 lockdown. The factory, owned by Taiwan's Quanta, has been operating under tight restrictions since the beginning of April. The employees are reportedly worried about positive COVID-19 cases on the campus. Tensions broke after workers tried to return to dormitories after their shifts.

64.title: Hamilton wears 3 watches, 8 rings, 4 necklaces in protest of F1's jewellery ban, pic viral
64.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton attended a press conference ahead of the Miami Grand Prix wearing three watches, eight rings, four necklaces and two earrings. It was in a protest of F1's ruling which bars drivers from wearing jewellery while racing. "I feel like it's almost like a step backwards," Hamilton said.

65.title: Beyond proud of you: Shibani as Farhan gets cast in MCU's 'Ms Marvel'
65.article_body: Shibani Dandekar took to Instagram on Saturday to confirm her actor-husband Farhan Akhtar's participation in Marvel Studios' upcoming web series 'Ms Marvel'. "Can't wait for this one!! First mainstream leading Indian actor to be part of the Marvel Universe! Beyond proud of you, Farhan," she wrote. Farhan also confirmed the news on his Instagram handle on Saturday.

66.title: My father inspired my character in 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar': Ranveer Singh
66.article_body: Ranveer Singh, in a recent interview, revealed that his father Jagjit Singh Bhavnani was his inspiration for his character in 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. The actor said, "[My father] would pour everything in the endeavour of giving us a better life which is the premise of Jayeshbhai's journey as well." Ranveer added that he now has a deeper appreciation for his father.

67.title: Russia claims to have destroyed stockpile of western weapons in Ukraine
67.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Saturday said its forces have destroyed a large stockpile of military equipment from the US and European countries near the Bohodukhiv railway station in Ukraine's Kharkiv region. The ministry also said it had hit 18 Ukrainian military facilities overnight, including three ammunition depots in Dachne. Russia has warned the West against sending more weapons to Ukraine.

68.title: US First Lady brings 5 gallons of ketchup for US troops deployed to Romania
68.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden brought five gallons of ketchup for US troops deployed to Romania. Ketchup was in short supply on the Mihail Kogalniceanu Air Base. The base is temporarily home to about 1,600 of the several thousand troops US President Joe Biden deployed to Eastern Europe in the leadup to the Russia-Ukraine war.

69.title: 5 held for terrorising villagers with weapons like sword, axe in Thane
69.article_body: Five people, including a woman, were arrested for allegedly terrorising residents of Dahisar Mori and Thakurpada villages in Thane, police said. "Between 12:15 am and 3:45 am on Friday, the accused moved around...carrying swords, choppers and axes...and terrorising...residents. They banged the doors of several houses and threatened the residents for no valid reason," police added.

70.title: Massive fire breaks out at Tata Steel plant in Jamshedpur, 3 workers injured
70.article_body: A massive fire broke out in a coke plant at the Tata Steel factory in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur due to an alleged blast in a battery on Saturday. Three contractual employees sustained minor injuries in the incident and were administered first aid, according to an official statement. Five fire tenders immediately rushed to the spot and brought the situation under control.

71.title: Rajnath calls for border development, says Chinese presence 'increased'
71.article_body: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has called for the development of border areas and urged Border Roads Organisation to increase its capability by using technology for infrastructure development. Chinese presence has increased in the Northern sector as they use their "proficiency in construction in mountainous areas" to reach places "quickly", he said. "BRO must...work in parallel," he added.

72.title: Tata Group Chairman buys house he was living on rent for 5 yrs for ₹98 crore
72.article_body: Tata Group Chairman N Chandrasekaran and his family have purchased a duplex worth ₹98 crore in Mumbai's Pedder Road. The family had been residing in the duplex on lease for the last five years. Situated on the 11th and 12th floor of a 28-storey building, the family has reportedly been paying a monthly rent of ₹20 lakh for that house.

73.title: Actress Nayanthara, director Vignesh Shivan to tie the knot on June 9: Report
73.article_body: Actress Nayanthara, who predominantly appears in Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam cinema, is set to tie the knot with director Vignesh Shivan on June 9, as per reports. The duo will get married at Tirumala Tirupati temple in Andhra Pradesh in the presence of family members and close friends, reports said. Nayanthara got engaged to Vignesh in 2021.

74.title: Rahul plays with the mind of the bowlers and traps them: Suresh Raina
74.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina said LSG captain KL Rahul is in the "best" phase of his career, adding that he is playing some amazing shots. "Rahul plays with the mind of the bowlers and traps them. He forces the bowlers to bowl in the areas which are his strong zones and constructs his innings accordingly," stated Raina.

75.title: Pune city records decline in maximum temperature: Report
75.article_body: The maximum temperature in Pune city has been recorded at normal levels on Friday, with the night temperature dropping to 19°C, according to a report. The weather in the city is likely to remain pleasant over the next few days, weather department officials said. Notably, the temperature remained high in other parts of Maharashtra.

76.title: 3 more arrested by Delhi Police in Jahangirpuri violence case
76.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three more accused in connection with the communal clashes that broke out in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on April 16, officials said on Saturday. One accused was seen brandishing a pistol in CCTV footage, an official said. The other two were "actively" involved in the clashes, the official added. A total of 36 people have been arrested so far.

77.title: Sharda University responds after 'Nazism, Hindu right wing similarities' question in exam
77.article_body: Sharda University has responded after its BA Political Science question paper asked students about similarities between "fascism/Nazism and Hindu right wing (Hindutva)". The university said it has constituted a three-member committee to look into the possibility of bias in the questions, adding that the concerned faculty has been suspended, pending inquiry. It expressed regret over the incident.

78.title: Deforestation in Brazilian Amazon breaks all records for April
78.article_body: Deforestation seen in Brazilian Amazon broke all records for April, corresponding to more than 1,000 square kilometres. The figure is the highest seen in seven years of record-keeping and 74% more than the same month in 2021, which was the prior record. It's the first time that deforestation alerts have surpassed 1,000 square kilometres during a month in rainy season.

79.title: Delhi Metro announces new interchange hub at RK Ashram Marg metro station
79.article_body: A new interchange hub will be constructed at central Delhi's RK Ashram Marg metro station, DMRC announced. "RK Ashram Marg station on Blue Line is being converted into an interchange. It will be connecting RK Ashram Marg station of Magenta Line," the DMRC said. "Commuters will have access to alternate & shorter routes from Central to North Delhi," DMRC added.

80.title: Toxic gas inside a well claims lives of 2 fishermen in Jharkhand
80.article_body: Two fishermen died after inhaling toxic gas inside a well at Bhusahi village in Jharkhand's Palamu district. The deceased, identified as Patali Singh (37) and Ramchandra Choudhary (40), had gone inside the 30-feet deep well to catch fish, police said. Notably, the bodies have been recovered and sent to the Medinirai Medical College and Hospital for postmortem.

81.title: Raid at IAS officer's CA's home reveals ₹17 crore in cash in J'khand, video viral
81.article_body: A viral video has shown hordes of cash discovered during a raid at the house of a CA linked to Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal. The raid by Enforcement Directorate officials on Friday was carried out in connection with the alleged diversion of MGNREGA funds. Over ₹17 crores were recovered during the raid at the Ranchi-based CA's house.

82.title: Don't know how Miller couldn't connect any ball in final over vs MI: Sehwag
82.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said he cannot understand how GT batter David Miller failed to connect any ball in the final over of his team's chase against MI, with GT defeated by five runs. "The bowling...was not that special that [it] prevented them from scoring those nine runs. The last two balls did not even touch Miller's bat," added Sehwag.

83.title: Fascinating why a player of his class was left out: Vettori on MI's David
83.article_body: Reacting to MI all-rounder Tim David's 44* off 21 balls against GT, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "Not one ball did he slog." "It would be fascinating to understand why a player of his class was left out," added Vettori. "You...don't see such clean hitting with such pure shot making at the back end of an IPL innings," stated Vettori.

84.title: Woman raped for 79 days by tantrik in Odisha, rescued by police
84.article_body: A married woman was allegedly raped repeatedly by a 'tantrik' while being on his premises for 79 days in Baleswar, Odisha. The woman was repeatedly raped by the accused in front of the former's 2.5 years old son, police said after rescuing them. Notably, the survivor has named her husband and in-laws as well in the FIR.

85.title: Before 'Gully Boy', it felt like 'jackpot' to get any film: Vijay Varma
85.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma said things have changed for him post 'Gully Boy' as before that, it felt like a 'jackpot' to get any film. The actor added that choosing the right script has become more difficult now "because you are spoilt for options". "You have to decide which ones you can carry on your shoulder," Varma said.

86.title: Global bird populations steadily declining: Study
86.article_body: According to a study, the population of birds worldwide is declining rapidly. Approximately 48% of existing bird species are known or suspected to be undergoing population decline, 39% are stable, and only 6% are showing an increase in population. The key threats leading to this decline are loss and degradation of natural habitats, direct overexploitation of species and climate change.

87.title: Registrations begin for Sony TV's Shark Tank India season 2
87.article_body: After a successful first season and investing Rs. 42 crore across 67 businesses, Sony TV has opened registrations for Shark Tank India season 2. Whether you are a home entrepreneur, business owner, start-up or just have a business idea, here's your chance to realise your business dream and scale it. Download or update Sony Liv to register now

88.title: A week's break from social media improves mental well-being: Study
88.article_body: As per new research, taking a week's break from social media not only improves an individual's overall well-being but also reduces symptoms of depression and anxiety. "Social media is a part of life...But if you are spending hours each week scrolling...it's negatively impacting you," researchers said. "Many of our participants reported positive effects from being off social media," they added.

89.title: Tim David finished things really well: Rohit after win over GT
89.article_body: After MI batter Tim David scored 44*(21) against GT, which helped MI secure their second win of IPL 2022, skipper Rohit Sharma has said that the Singaporean batter finished their innings "really well". Notably, David was dropped from MI's playing XI after just two games. Since his comeback, David has played unbeaten knocks in both victories of MI this season.

90.title: Warrant issued against wife of Mamata Banerjee's nephew in WB coal scam case
90.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday issued a bailable warrant against Rujira Banerjee, wife of TMC General Secretary and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee, after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) claimed she failed to appear before it despite multiple summons. Abhishek and Rujira have been named as accused in a money laundering case linked to an alleged coal scam.

91.title: Depp's supporters claim Amber Heard posed for photo while crying in court, video surfaces
91.article_body: Actress Amber Heard broke down in court as she testified against her ex-husband, actor Johnny Depp during the ongoing defamation trial. She can be seen wiping her nose with a tissue and then appears to be posing for the media for a few seconds, claimed social media users. Several Twitter users shared videos while alleging that she posed for photos.

92.title: Twitter CEO's wife is General Partner at VC firm backing Musk's Twitter deal
92.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal's wife Vineeta Agarwala is a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz, the venture capital (VC) firm that has agreed to invest $400 million in Elon Musk's Twitter takeover deal. Vineeta leads investments for Andreessen Horowitz's biotech and medical fund. As per reports, Musk is expected to serve as the temporary Twitter CEO after he completes the takeover.

93.title: Bowlers took us over the line: MI's Tim David after win over GT
93.article_body: Mumbai Indians batter Tim David has said that bowlers got Mumbai Indians "over the line" in the match against Gujarat Titans, which the former won by 5 runs. "It was a good batting wicket...Shows how well our bowlers bowled in the second half to get us over the line," said the 26-year-old Singaporean cricketer.

94.title: NVIDIA to pay $5.5 million penalty over cryptomining disclosures
94.article_body: NVIDIA has agreed to pay $5.5 million to settle civil charges that it did not properly disclose the impact of cryptomining on its gaming business. In consecutive quarters in FY 2018, NVIDIA failed to reveal that cryptomining was a "significant element" of its revenue growth from sales of chips designed for gaming. NVIDIA did not admit or deny the findings.

95.title: I hope both work at box office: Kartik on 'Bhool...' & 'Dhaakad' clash
95.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan opened up about the box office clash between his upcoming horror-comedy 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and Kangana Ranaut-starrer action film 'Dhaakad'. Stating that both the films belong to very different genres, Kartik said, "On May 20, the moviegoers would have the option to watch 2 films. I hope both (Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 and Dhaakad) work at box office."

96.title: Shaab is back with gift of LPG price: Pawan Khera on PM Modi's Europe tour
96.article_body: Congress' Pawan Khera criticised BJP government for surge in price of LPG cylinders and said that "shaab (PM Narendra Modi) is back after 65 hours, 60 photoshoots across three countries with this gift of LPG price." He said, "Today a situation is created where people have to surrender LPG cylinders." The LPG cylinder price has been increased by ₹50 today.

97.title: 4 booked for assaulting woman, minor son in Pimpri Chinchwad
97.article_body: A  female shop owner and three others were booked for physically assaulting a female tenant and her minor son in a dispute about rent in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad, the police said on Friday. The boy was attacked with a hammer for filming the attack on his mother, an official said. The police have registered a case and initiated a probe.

98.title: Man killed by wife's relatives in Hyd sold gold chain to take her Eid shopping
98.article_body: A 25-year-old Hindu man who was allegedly killed by his Muslim wife's relatives in Hyderabad over their marriage had sold his gold chain to take her Eid shopping, the man's colleague said. The HR manager at the car showroom that employed Nagaraju said the latter had sold his chain for ₹25,000. Nagaraju was stabbed to death on a busy road.

99.title: I walked out of shower and someone asked me for picture: Ileana
99.article_body: Actress Ileana D'Cruz in an interview has revealed that recently she walked out of the shower and someone asked her for a picture. The actress added that she was dressed but her hair was wet and she wasn't expecting to bump into someone. "I used to be a lot more reserved about things like that but...I indulge now," she said.

100.title: Fascinating why a player of his class was left out: Vettori on MI's David
100.article_body: Reacting to MI all-rounder Tim David's 44* off 21 balls against GT, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "Not one ball did he slog." "It would be fascinating to understand why a player of his class was left out," added Vettori. "You...don't see such clean hitting with such pure shot making at the back end of an IPL innings," stated Vettori.

101.title: PBKS to bat first as RR lose toss for 10th time in IPL 2022, playing XIs announced
101.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal won the toss and elected to bat first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. It is the 10th time in 11 IPL 2022 matches that RR captain Sanju Samson lost the toss. PBKS are fielding an unchanged side, while Yashasvi Jaiswal has replaced Karun Nair in RR's playing XI.

102.title: Berlin bans Russian & Ukrainian flags during WWII commemoration
102.article_body: Berlin authorities have banned Russian and Ukrainian flags from being flown near the German city's memorials and monuments this weekend as the country commemorates the 77th anniversary of the end of World War II. Berlin police warned that it'll take action "against any form of support, approval, or even glorification of Russia's war of aggression on Ukraine, especially in gatherings".

103.title: Man booked under UAPA gets 7 yrs in jail after he accepts guilt in Mumbai
103.article_body: A Mumbai court sentenced a 39-year-old man, booked under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA), to seven years in jail after he accepted his guilt. He has been convicted for his links to ISIS. "The man was allegedly planning to assist an ISIS member in making explosives to cause a blast during the month of Ramzan," as per NIA.

104.title: Taliban makes covering face in public must for women, says all-covering burqa is best
104.article_body: Taliban on Saturday ruled that Afghan women must cover their faces in public, according to a decree from the group's supreme leader Hibatullah Akhundzada. The decree stated that the ideal face covering was the all-covering blue burqa. A Taliban spokesperson said a woman's father or closest male relative could be imprisoned if she didn't cover her face outside the home.

105.title: Musk didn't have plan for Twitter: CEO of Binance which is investing $500 mn in buyout
105.article_body: Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao told Financial Times that the cryptocurrency exchange's $500 million investment to help Elon Musk acquire Twitter is "more of a blank cheque". He said, "[Musk] didn't have a plan for Twitter. There isn't...a business plan." Zhao further said, "After the investment...Elon will figure out what he wants to do, and we'll be supportive of that."

106.title: Was called a 'stick' in South industry, asked to lose weight in Mumbai: Rakul
106.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh revealed that she was asked to put on some weight in the South film industry. "When I debuted, I was told I'm too thin...People would call me 'stick' and I'd say 'no'...But after two-three years I gave in," she said. Rakul added when she came to Mumbai to work in Bollywood, she was asked to lose weight.

107.title: Don't know how Miller couldn't connect any ball in final over vs MI: Sehwag
107.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said he cannot understand how GT batter David Miller failed to connect any ball in the final over of his team's chase against MI, with GT defeated by five runs. "The bowling...was not that special that [it] prevented them from scoring those nine runs. The last two balls did not even touch Miller's bat," added Sehwag.

108.title: PNB hikes interest rates on select term deposits by up to 60 bps
108.article_body: Punjab National Bank (PNB) will increase interest rates on term deposits in selected buckets by up to 60 basis points with effect from today. It has also increased the repo-linked lending rate (RLLR) from 6.5% to 6.9% with effect from June 1 for existing customers. The move comes after several banks raised interest rates following the RBI's repo rate hike.

109.title: Directors have manipulated, taken advantage of me: Abhay Deol
109.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol has revealed that he has been manipulated, taken advantage of and gaslit by directors he worked with. "There are directors who don't have your best interests at heart and are just using you to get ahead in life," he added. Abhay further said that he had to experience it otherwise he would have been naive and idealistic.

110.title: I was called unprofessional, they won't say that about superstars: Bobby
110.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has revealed he was called unprofessional without basis, adding he never cancelled a shoot and has never been late. "Nobody says anything about [superstars] because they have a market. But when there are people...who have a limited market, people jump at you at the first opportunity," he added. Bobby further said that such charges "obviously" bothered him.

111.title: Will Smith's 'Emancipation' to be delayed due to Oscars slap incident: Report
111.article_body: Actor Will Smith's upcoming film 'Emancipation' is reportedly being delayed following his Oscars slap incident. According to Variety, Apple is planning to postpone the film's release to 2023. Notably, several of Will's projects are on hold after the actor slapped comedian Chris Rock onstage after the latter made a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith's medical condition.

112.title: Bars, restaurants serving liquor in Gurugram allowed to remain open 24x7
112.article_body: As part of the Haryana government's new liquor licensing policy, bars and restaurants serving liquor in Gurugram will have the option to remain open 24x7. The new rules aim to counter Delhi's excise policy, under which bars and restaurants serving liquor can remain open till 3 am. The establishments can start serving liquor from 8 am from June onwards.

113.title: Lake next to landfill turns pink due to cyanobacteria in Chennai
113.article_body: A lake, next to a landfill, in Chennai's Perungudi in Tamil Nadu, has turned pink. The phenomenon is due to the presence of cyanobacteria, a professor at the National Institute of Technical Teachers' Training and Research said. "This is an algal bloom...here we don't have any industries...the colour of the water turned pink because of the leachate," the professor added.

114.title: Man gets life term for killing 18-year-old in Rajasthan in 2014
114.article_body: A special court in Rajasthan's Bundi sentenced a 30-year-old man to life imprisonment for murdering an 18-year-old woman in 2014. During the investigation, it was found that the convict had lured the woman, taken her away and allegedly raped her before strangling her to death. He had dumped her body in a well, which was recovered nine days later.

115.title: Greater Noida Authority to invoke Gangster Act against offenders
115.article_body: The Greater Noida Authority will invoke Gangster Act against builders or individuals found involved in land encroachment. The decision was taken at a meeting chaired by newly appointed Greater Noida Authority CEO Surendra Singh. Officials have been asked to draw up a list of land mafias and individual work circle officers have been asked to submit lists of illegal constructions.

116.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' crosses ₹400 crore in Hindi, second film to do so
116.article_body: The Hindi version of 'KGF: Chapter 2' has become the second film to cross the ₹400 crore mark, only behind 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'. The Hindi version of SS Rajamouli's film had earned ₹511 crore. 'KGF: Chapter 2' had previously surpassed the lifetime business of the film 'Dangal' to become the second-highest grossing film in Hindi ever.

117.title: Avinash Sable becomes fastest Indian to run 5,000 metres, breaks 30-year-old record
117.article_body: Runner Avinash Sable has become the fastest Indian to run 5,000 metres. The 27-year-old achieved the feat by clocking 13:25.65 at the Sound Running Track Meet in the US. He broke the national record set by Bahadur Prasad, who had clocked 13:29.70 in June 1992 at Barcelona Olympics. Sable finished 12th at the meet in San Juan Capistrano.

118.title: Bled through my pants, couldn't get a tampon during meeting: TikTok ex-employee
118.article_body: A former employee at TikTok claimed that she bled through her pants instead of leaving a meeting to get a tampon amid the high-pressure work culture at the company. In a recent report, former employees have cited 85 hours of meetings a week, lack of sleep and mental anguish as some of the things they faced at the company.

119.title: Mumbai man refusing to vacate flat for redevelopment to pay ₹5 lakh to housing society
119.article_body: The Bombay HC imposed ₹5 lakh on a Mumbai housing society's member, who wasn't vacating his flat, which is in a dilapidated building, so a developer could demolish it and construct a new one in its place. The HC directed him to vacate the flat within two weeks, failing which, the court receiver would take forcible possession of the house.

120.title: 2 men call gathering of Muslims in Karnataka 'small Pakistan'; held
120.article_body: Two men were arrested after they allegedly called a gathering of people in Nanjangud in Karnataka's Mysuru "chhota (small) Pakistan" in a video. According to the police, the video of the incident shows Muslim men standing on the road after offering prayers and shouting slogans. The incident reportedly took place on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr on May 3.

121.title: Survey of Gyanvapi mosque complex near Kashi Vishwanath temple begins in UP
121.article_body: The court-ordered survey of Gyanvapi mosque complex next to Kashi Vishwanath temple in UP has begun. The survey was ordered on a plea by five women to gain yearlong access to prayers at a Hindu shrine in the Gyanvapi-Kashi Vishwanath complex. Prayers are currently only allowed once a year at the shrine. Protests were reported from the site on Friday.

122.title: Video captures massive explosion at 5-star hotel in Havana
122.article_body: A video of a massive explosion at a five-star hotel that claimed at least 22 lives in the Cuban capital of Havana has surfaced online. The video showed plumes of dust and smoke rising from the building. Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel has said that the explosion at Hotel Saratoga appears to have been caused by a gas leak.

123.title: Ukraine conflict taking heavy toll on Russia’s most capable units: UK
123.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said the Ukraine conflict is taking a "heavy toll on some of Russia's most capable units and most advanced capabilities". The ministry added that it would "take considerable time and expense for Russia to reconstitute its armed forces" following the conflict and would be "particularly challenging to replace modernised and advanced equipment" due to Western sanctions.

124.title: Buttler can break Kohli's record of highest runs in IPL season: Harbhajan
124.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said RR opener Jos Buttler can break Virat Kohli's record for scoring highest runs in an IPL season, adding that he "will" break it if RR reach the IPL 2022 final. "It's very difficult to stop him," stated Harbhajan. Kohli had set the record by aggregating 973 runs for RCB in IPL 2016.

125.title: Punjab Police arrested me like a terrorist: Tajinder Bagga
125.article_body: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga has alleged that the Punjab Police arrested him on Friday as "they do it with a terrorist". "I was not shown any warrant...I told them to let me tie my turban. They did not give me the chance to wear the turban and slippers...Nearly 50 policemen came (in)," Bagga said.

126.title: Pune court orders wildlife offenders to build waterholes in forests
126.article_body: A court in Pune has directed two people accused of wildlife offences to build two waterholes each for wild animals in separate cases. The Deputy Conservators of Forest of Pune and Junnar divisions welcomed the step calling it a "unique" and an "environment-friendly" punishment, respectively. According to forest authorities, the court also imposed ₹10,000 fine on one of the offenders.

127.title: BJP should ask who offered CM's post to Yatnal for ₹2,500 cr: DK Shivakumar
127.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Saturday urged BJP to ask party MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal about those who offered him CM's post for money. "Why do they need proof when there's everything available with...Yatnal?" Shivakumar said. This comes after the BJP MLA claimed that "some people from Delhi" had offered him CM's role in exchange for ₹2,500 crore.

128.title: B'luru Customs seize ₹50 lakh-gold hidden in underwear; 1 arrested
128.article_body: Bengaluru Customs tweeted on Friday that a passenger who was allegedly attempting to smuggle gold in paste form, worth over ₹50 lakh, by concealing it in underwear has been arrested. It said that the passenger was intercepted based on intel from the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence. The gold weighed 966.1 gm and further investigations are underway, it added.

129.title: Hope world would sanction China if it invades Taiwan: Foreign Min
129.article_body: Taiwanese Foreign Minister Joseph Wu said Taiwan hopes that the international community will sanction China like it's sanctioning Russia for the Ukraine war, if Beijing invades it. Taiwan has joined in Western-led sanctions on Russia and its ally Belarus over the Ukraine invasion. The move is largely symbolic given the island's minimal levels of direct trade with Belarus or Russia.

130.title: Body of missing law student found in Patiala's Bhakra canal
130.article_body: The body of a woman from Kolkata, studying in LLB final year at Rajiv Gandhi National University of Law in Patiala, was recovered from Bhakra canal on Friday, police said. The woman had gone missing along with her batchmate on May 2. Police said there's no clue about the 23-year-old man, adding they are investigating the case from all angles.

131.title: Associates of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi arrested in Gurugram
131.article_body: The Gurugram Police arrested three people in two separate raids suspected to be associates of gangsters Lawrence Bishnoi and Goldy Brar. Three country-made pistols and ammunition were recovered by the police in the first raid at the Mubarikpur crossing, police said. However, in the second raid in Manesar, two pistols and 20 live cartridges were recovered from the two suspects.

132.title: HDFC hikes home loan rates by 30 bps after RBI's repo rate hike
132.article_body: HDFC on Saturday raised its Retail Prime Lending Rate (RPLR) on home loans by 30 basis points, which will be effective from May 9. Earlier, the lender had increased its benchmark lending rate by 5 basis points. Notably, the Reserve Bank of India hiked the repo rate by 40 basis points earlier this week.

133.title: Brazil's Vale signs long-term deal to supply Tesla with nickel
133.article_body: Brazilian miner Vale SA has signed a long-term deal with Tesla to supply the EV maker with nickel from its Canadian operations. The agreement involves supplying Tesla with low-carbon Class 1 nickel. Vale said it aims for between 30% and 40% of its Class 1 nickel sales to go to the EV sector.

134.title: When I got opportunities to play Tests after Ganguly's retirement, I got cancer: Yuvraj
134.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh, in a recent interview, said he wanted to play 100 Tests for India. "When I got opportunities to play Tests after Dada's (Sourav Ganguly) retirement...I got diagnosed with cancer," he added. He stated, "It has just been bad luck. I tried 24x7. I wanted to play 100 Tests...I gave it everything...but it wasn't meant to be."

135.title: Arsenal offered new contract the day we lost 3 consecutive matches: Arteta
135.article_body: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta who has signed a contract extension until 2025, said the club offered him the new contract on the day when they lost three consecutive matches. "The club was so decisive and committed," added Arteta. Arsenal lost three consecutive matches in April after being defeated by Crystal Palace, Brighton and Southampton in Premier League matches.

136.title: 7 of a family die in car crash on Yamuna Expressway in UP; PM expresses condolences
136.article_body: At least seven members of a family were killed and two were injured when a car collided with another vehicle on Yamuna Expressway in UP's Mathura on Saturday. "Among those killed, three are women, three men...one child died on the spot," police said. "My deepest condolences to those who lost their loved ones in this accident," PM Narendra Modi tweeted.

137.title: Woman beaten by estranged husband's lawyer at MP court as baby seen lying on ground
137.article_body: A woman was beaten by her estranged husband's lawyer at a court in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district, with the video of the incident showing her baby lying on ground. The lawyer can be seen chasing the woman and punching her in the back. Local police told PTI that the incident took place on Thursday, and they have booked the lawyer.

138.title: Anupam shares pics with Rajamouli, says 'Was wonderful to talk about our epics'
138.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram on Friday to share a series of pictures from his meeting with filmmaker SS Rajamouli at Goafest. "What an awesome man! Wonderful to talk to him about joint families, childhood stories, our epics and of course about life in cinema," he captioned the pictures with the hashtags 'RRR' and 'The Kashmir Files'.

139.title: Liquor likely to get cheaper in Gurugram as Haryana govt cuts taxes
139.article_body: The prices of imported foreign liquor (IFL) in Gurugram are likely to decrease from June as the Haryana government has reduced the excise duty and value-added tax (VAT) on the sale of liquor. The state government's new excise policy will come into effect from June 12. The policy will also allow more liquor vends in a single zone.

140.title: Bengaluru Police busts cricket betting racket, seize ₹4 lakh
140.article_body: Bengaluru Central Crime Branch (CCB) busted a cricket betting racket on Friday and arrested a person in Halasuru PS limits for illegal betting during IPL T-20 match. The accused was allegedly betting on a cricket match between Gujarat Titans and Mumbai Indians. The police seized cash worth ₹4 lakh and a mobile phone from the arrested person.

141.title: American billionaire Boehly-led group to buy Chelsea in £4.25-bn deal from Abramovich
141.article_body: Chelsea have agreed terms on the £4.25-billion sale of the club to a consortium led by American billionaire Todd Boehly, who is a co-owner of the LA Dodgers baseball team. The club was put up for sale before owner Roman Abramovich was sanctioned for his alleged links to Russian President Vladimir Putin following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

142.title: Musk, Twitter sued by Florida pension fund to delay $44 bn deal
142.article_body: Elon Musk and Twitter were sued by a Florida pension fund seeking to stop Musk from completing his $44 billion buyout before 2025. The fund cited a Delaware law under which shareholders who own over 15% of a company can't enter a merger without two-thirds of remaining shares granting approval. Musk is effective "owner" of over 15% of Twitter shares.

143.title: Obesity may weaken vaccine protection: Study
143.article_body: Obesity may weaken vaccine protection against COVID-19 in people, who have never been infected with the coronavirus, a study has found. Researchers compared the effect of vaccination on people without previous SARS-CoV-2 infection, who received the Pfizer vaccine, and found that patients with severe obesity had over three times lower antibody levels than normal-weight individuals.

144.title: Farhan to debut in Marvel Cinematic Universe with 'Ms Marvel': Report
144.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar will reportedly make his debut in the Marvel Cinematic Universe with 'Ms Marvel', an upcoming series which will also feature Iman Vellani and Pakistani actor Fawad Khan. According to Deadline, Farhan will make a guest appearance in the series. 'Ms Marvel' will feature Iman as Kamala Khan, who's a Muslim American teenager growing up in Jersey City.

145.title: Game was in their favour, will take with both hands: Rohit on MI beating GT
145.article_body: Discussing MI's win against GT by five runs, MI captain Rohit Sharma said, "Things were in their favour...We will take this with both hands." "We were 15-20 runs short," added Rohit. "I felt they like pace coming on to the bat, so we wanted to take that off," stated Rohit. It was MI's second consecutive win in IPL 2022.

146.title: It was my gift: Ronaldinho on Lionel Messi's first goal for Barcelona
146.article_body: Talking about seven-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi's first goal for former club Barcelona, Brazilian legend Ronaldinho who assisted the goal tweeted, "How easy it is to play with this beast! First goal was my gift." Ronaldinho chipped the ball over two defenders in the match played on May 1, 2005 with Messi converting with a chip as well.

147.title: ED staff threatened top executives with physical violence during probe: Xiaomi
147.article_body: Xiaomi alleged that its top executives faced threats of "physical violence" during questioning by Enforcement Directorate. It said that its India MD Manu Kumar Jain, current Financial Officer Sameer and their families were warned by ED officials of "dire consequences" if they didn’t submit the statements needed by them. ED had seized Xiaomi's ₹5,551 crore assets over forex violations recently.

148.title: Every death scientifically registered: K'taka Health Min on WHO COVID data
148.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar accused the World Health Organization (WHO) of exaggerating the number of deaths due to COVID-19 in India without any scientific evidence and rational reasoning. "We stick to our own numbers...Every death in this country has been scientifically registered," he said. "Every death is registered in the most fragmented way in India," he added.

149.title: Ex-US policeman jailed over violent arrest of woman with dementia
149.article_body: An ex-US police officer was sentenced to five years in prison for assaulting a 73-year-old woman with dementia and later joking about it with colleagues. Karen Garner was left with a broken arm, sprained wrist and a shoulder injury during the 2020 arrest by officer Austin Hopp. Garner was arrested for forgetting to pay about $14 for items at Walmart.

150.title: Policeman suffers serious injuries in terrorist firing in Srinagar
150.article_body: A policeman suffered serious injuries after terrorists opened fire at him in J&K's Srinagar on Saturday morning. He was reportedly riding a bike when he was attacked at the Aiwa Bridge. According to officials, the policeman is deployed with the emergency flying squad. He is critical and has been moved to a hospital for treatment, officials added.

151.title: Man booked as 2-month-old son dies after he threw him on floor in Punjab
151.article_body: A man was booked by Punjab's Ludhiana police on Friday following the death of his two-month-old son after he allegedly threw the baby on the floor on suspicion that the baby was a result of his wife's extra-marital affair. The wife claimed that the accused was unemployed and addicted to drugs and had done so following an argument between them.

152.title: JNU council approves 70% licence fee waiver for shops inside campus
152.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru University's (JNU) Executive Council (EC) on Friday approved a 70% licence fee waiver for shops inside the campus. "The council approved the waiver of 70% of licence fee to all the shops allotted by JNU which were closed during 2020 and 2021 on account of lockdown due to the spread of COVID-19," the Registrar said.

153.title: Punjab man dies while saving daughter after son-in-law hits her
153.article_body: A 58-year-old man has died after he allegedly tried to save his daughter who was being hit by her husband after she refused his demand of a scooter as dowry in Punjab's Ludhiana. The daughter claimed that when her father intervened, her "inebriated" husband pushed the latter, who then fell unconscious. The daughter also claimed her husband assaulted her "regularly".

154.title: Actor Mohan Juneja, who featured in 'KGF', passes away aged 54
154.article_body: Actor and comedian Mohan Juneja, who featured in both parts of 'KGF', passed away aged 54 on Saturday at a private hospital in Bengaluru. Juneja, who hailed from Karnataka's Tumakuru district, was suffering from a prolonged illness. He worked in over 100 movies in Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Hindi languages.

155.title: Ukrainian father seen showing his 15-yr-old dead son's blood to captured Russian soldier
155.article_body: A picture of a Ukrainian man showing his 15-year-old dead son's blood to a captured Russian soldier has surfaced on social media. The boy died of his injuries after a shelling raid in Kharkiv. The boy was with his parents and other workers helping to evacuate animals from a zoo when a shell landed nearby.

156.title: Govt may privatise one of its 3 general insurers after LIC IPO launch: Report
156.article_body: After the launch of LIC's IPO, the Centre may privatise one of its general insurance companies this year, said a report. It detailed that by the time LIC is listed on stock exchanges, the government will start work to identify one of its three general insurers, namely, National Insurance Co., United India Insurance Co. and Oriental India Insurance for privatisation.

157.title: China to ban minors from tipping livestreamers & watching after 10 pm
157.article_body: China has ordered internet platforms to stop underage users from tipping livestreamers or becoming livestreamers themselves without guardian consent. The platforms will also need to strengthen the management of peak hours for such shows and shows will need to be "forcibly" turned off by 10 pm local time for users of their parental control "youth mode" functions.

158.title: Tamil Nadu CM takes bus ride, speaks to people about 1 yr of governance
158.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM and DMK leader MK Stalin on Saturday took a ride on a Municipal Transport Corporation bus in Chennai as his government completed one year of governance. "He spoke with passengers and the conductor on one year of his governance," ANI reported. "He inquired about the benefits of the free bus fare to women," the CM's office tweeted.

159.title: Army major falls off cliff during anti-terror operation in J&K's Uri; dies
159.article_body: Indian Army Major Raghunath Ahlawat, 34, reportedly died after falling off a steep cliff during a counter-infiltration operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Uri on Thursday. He was leading the operation near the Line of Control in Baramulla when he slipped due to bad weather and fell in a 60-metre-deep ravine. He died on the way to the hospital, officials said.

160.title: BJP just bothered about what Punjab and Maha Police are doing: Raut
160.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut criticised BJP government and said that inflation is the "biggest issue" in the country but neither PM nor FM or BJP leaders are speaking on it. "They are just bothered about what police in Punjab and Maharashtra are doing," he added. People gave befitting reply to those who tried to spoil situation in Maharashtra, Raut said.

161.title: Maharashtra govt is scared of Raj Thackeray: Cong's Sanjay Nirupam
161.article_body: Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam has claimed that the Maharashtra state government is scared of MNS chief Raj Thackeray and therefore, not taking any action against him. "The Maharashtra Police had set 16 conditions for the rally in Aurangabad, out of which he (Raj) has violated 12...I don't understand why is the Mumbai Police not doing anything?" Nirupam asked.

162.title: Gang claiming to have magical powers to multiply money held in Hyderabad
162.article_body: Hyderabad's Meerpet police on Friday busted a woman-led gang for cheating people by claiming to have magical powers that could multiply money. The six-member gang was apprehended after a man from Hasthinapuram complained of being duped of ₹11 lakh by the accused. According to police, main accused, Sulthana, is a habitual offender who had been arrested earlier in similar offences.

163.title: Tesla to cover travel costs for staff seeking abortion amid Supreme Court draft leak
163.article_body: Tesla has said that it will cover travel costs for employees seeking out-of-state abortions amid a leaked draft of the US Supreme Court that would abolish a nationwide right to abortion. The company said it would also offer lodging support for those who may need to seek "healthcare services that are unavailable in their home state."

164.title: UK to send mobile generators to Ukraine as 'Putin’s atrocities escalate'
164.article_body: The UK said it'd give Ukraine 287 mobile generators in addition to the 569 generators it donated earlier. "[Russian President Vladimir] Putin’s atrocities have continued to escalate, and so we're ramping up our support to the Ukrainian people...Our donation of a further 287 generators will ensure more essential services in Ukraine can keep running," UK Energy Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng said.

165.title: People get intimidated, feel that I'd explode: Divyenndu on playing Munna
165.article_body: 'Mirzapur' actor Divyenndu, when asked if his fans confuse him as Munna Bhaiya in real life, said, "I'm completely opposite to Munna in my real life." "I am glad that now, the audience knows the difference between a reel and a real-life hero, but when I meet people, they still get intimidated. They feel that I might explode," Divyenndu added.

166.title: Playing vs Venus is like playing against myself, very frustrating: Serena
166.article_body: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams said the "most frustrating" thing about playing against her sister Venus Williams, is that it is similar to playing against herself. "It would be an ace against anyone else but she gets it back," added Serena. "I am pretty tough and she is pretty tough, so she gets every ball back," stated Serena.

167.title: Which 14 batters have been out hit wicket in 15 years of IPL?
167.article_body: GT's Sai Sudharsan on Friday became the 14th batter to get out hit wicket in IPL. Musavir Khote was the first batter to get out hit wicket in IPL, while playing for MI against KXIP in 2008. IPL 2016 witnessed three hit wicket dismissals, the most in an IPL season. Four hit wicket dismissals in IPL have been against MI.

168.title: Need to make way for youngsters for PCC elections: P Chidambaram
168.article_body: Addressing Congress party workers, Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram said that there is a need to make way for youngsters for the elections of Pradesh Congress Committees (PCC). "If in 1929-30, Jawaharlal Nehru can become AICC chairman then, why can't a 40-year-old persons become president of District Congress Committee, why can't he or she become a block president," Chidambaram added.

169.title: Pune MNS leader threatens police over loudspeaker removal from mosques
169.article_body: General Secretary of the MNS' Pune unit has written a letter to Pune Police Commissioner demanding that the Maulvis of mosques in the city should inform the party through the police that they've removed or stopped using loudspeakers for 'azan'. The letter warned that if this is not done then Hanuman Chalisa will be played in front of police stations.

170.title: Karnataka to take over 51 heath centres run by Bengaluru civic body
170.article_body: Karnataka health department will take over 51 health centres run by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), according to a statement. The BBMP, which previously had financial and administrative control over the health centres, will now supervise the health department, it said. This will "help integrate" central and state governments' health programmes, State Health Minister K Sudhakar said.

171.title: 4 held for murdering man missing since 2021 in Haryana
171.article_body: The Haryana Police arrested four people for allegedly murdering a 25-year-old man and burying his body in Haryana's Rewari. The deceased, identified as Ajay, was reportedly missing since December 2021. The accused revealed that Ajay was assaulted on suspicion of mobile theft and later, succumbed to injuries, police said. The four suspects were identified as Amit, Arun, Nishant and Rubal.

172.title: North Korea fires unidentified projectile amid warnings it may conduct nuclear test
172.article_body: North Korea has fired an unidentified projectile into the Sea of Japan, the South Korean military's Joint Chiefs of Staff said. The launch comes just three days after North Korea last fired a missile, as warnings grow that it may conduct a nuclear test. Earlier, US said North Korea could be ready to conduct a nuclear test this month.

173.title: Ajay confirms 'De De Pyaar De' sequel, says 'makers are writing the script'
173.article_body: A sequel to the comedy film 'De De Pyaar De' is in the works, Ajay Devgn confirmed in an interview. "I think they (makers) are writing the script," he added. The film, which was released in 2019, was directed by Akiv Ali. It also featured Tabu, Rakul Preet Singh, Jimmy Sheirgill and Jaaved Jaaferi	among others in pivotal roles.

174.title: Russian influencer poses naked next to 700-yr-old sacred tree at Bali temple; faces jail
174.article_body: A Russian female influencer faces six years in jail and a fine after posing naked next to a 700-year-old sacred tree at a temple in Bali. Alina Fazleeva has since deleted the photo and issued an apology on Instagram. "I'm so embarrassed, I didn't mean to offend you in any way, absolutely no knowledge of this place," she wrote.

175.title: Apple's AirTags sending new kind of false alarms to iPhone users: Report
175.article_body: Apple’s AirTags are sending out new kind of false alerts to their owners, as per a report by the Wall Street Journal.
