"Don't believe these thieves who come making offers like they will get you a ticket, make you meet Sonia Gandhi or JP Nadda," Yatnal added, while addressing a party event. Congress' DK Shivakumar demanded a probe into Yatnal's allegations.

350.title: We have ads on condoms, why not film? Rakul on 'Chhatriwali'
350.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about her upcoming film 'Chhatriwali', said the conversation around the use of condoms must be destigmatised. The actress added, "We have ads on protection so why not a film? That was the thought." Rakul will play a small-town girl who happens to stumble upon the job of the quality control head of a condom factory.

351.title: Thane man arrested for verbally abusing policeman on duty, biting him
351.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly verbally abusing and biting a policeman in Thane. According to police, the accused allegedly went up to the police jeep and banged his head on the windscreen and damaged it. The incident took place when a police team heard music being played in the Naupada area during patrolling and went to investigate.

352.title: 70-yr-old Pune man molests, rapes 3-yr-old girl residing in his building; arrested
352.article_body: A 70-year-old man was arrested for molesting and raping a three-year-old girl residing in his building in Pune. Police said the accused and the girl didn't know each other. "He lured the girl into his home and forced himself on her," a sub-inspector said. The girl narrated her ordeal to her mother when the latter found her without clothes.

353.title: Concerned about protecting people from COVID: Nitish on Shah's CAA remark
353.article_body: Reacting to Union Home Minister Amit Shah's CAA remark, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "It will be the decision of the Centre...coronavirus is still rising." "We are concerned regarding safeguarding the people from COVID," he added. Addressing a public rally in West Bengal, Amit Shah had said that Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) will be implemented the moment COVID-19 pandemic ends.

354.title: Climate change could spark next pandemic: Study
354.article_body: According to new study, the rising global temperature would lead to relocation of wild animals to areas with large human populations, thereby increasing the possibility of viral jump that could cause the next pandemic. The study stated that several mammals would encounter each other for the first time during such relocations called geographic range shifts and share thousands of viruses.

355.title: China builds permanent COVID testing stations for life after lockdown
355.article_body: China is setting up thousands of permanent PCR testing stations as authorities seek to "normalise" tough COVID-19 pandemic controls even after the current lockdowns end. According to officials, the stations will allow people to get tested in 15 minutes. Reportedly, the new system will make it a requirement for people to have a negative PCR test before entering public spaces.

356.title: Our career page has seen 8 lakh visits since WFH announcement: Airbnb
356.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky has said the firm's career page has been visited 8,00,000 times since it said it would have the option for employees to permanently work remotely. "The response internally was great, but even more impressive [was] the response externally," Chesky said. Airbnb said employees could move to anywhere in a country without a reduction in their compensation.

357.title: Power supply to over 3,200 slum dwellers cut off in Mumbai's Chembur
357.article_body: The power supply to over 3,200 slum dwellers was cut off in Mumbai's Chembur on Friday morning over non-payment of dues since 2005. The electricity dues have accrued to over ₹102 crore, a spokesperson for Adani Electricity said. "These defaulting consumers...are creating hindrance when our staff and partners visit door to door for collecting dues," the spokesperson added.

358.title: L&T Infotech announces merger with Mindtree
358.article_body: Larsen & Toubro Infotech (L&T Infotech) on Friday announced that its board has approved a scheme of amalgamation and arrangement with Mindtree. Under the scheme, L&T Infotech will issue 73 shares for every 100 shares of Mindtree. After the completion of the merger, Larsen & Toubro Limited will hold a 68.73% stake in 'LTIMindtree', the combined entity.

359.title: Musk told investors he could double their money if they backed Twitter deal: Report
359.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk told investors that he was highly confident he could double or triple their money if they backed his $44 billion buyout of Twitter, as per a report. He reportedly also said he could double Twitter's users to over 500 million by 2025. Musk is said to temporarily serve as Twitter CEO after the deal is closed.

360.title: Even I was under the impression that Hindi is the national language: Jaaved Jaaferi
360.article_body: While speaking on the national language debate, Jaaved Jaaferi said that he was also under the impression that Hindi is India's national language. "But I...looked up that the Constitution gives no language the status of a national language," he added. "There are so many religions but there's no national religion...You have a national bird or a national flower," said Jaaved.

361.title: 'We were under pressure', says Kane Williamson after loss to DC
361.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad skipper Kane Williamson admitted after their 21-run loss to the Delhi Capitals on Thursday that their side was "under pressure". "For us, it's just going back to the drawing board...We were put under pressure a lot in that first half and allowed them (DC) to get an above-par total," Williamson said.

362.title: One of the best innings for Delhi franchise: Pant on Warner's 92*(58)
362.article_body: After Delhi Capitals' opening batter David Warner scored 92*(58) against SunRisers Hyderabad on Thursday, skipper Rishabh Pant said that the Australian's knock was one of the "best" he has ever seen for the Delhi-based franchise. "The way he (Warner) batted, the way he paced the innings, it's one of the best innings I have seen," Pant said.

363.title: Mamata wants zero-opposition: Agnimitra Paul on BJP worker's death
363.article_body: West Bengal BJP's General Secretary Agnimitra Paul blamed TMC for the death of BJP worker Arjun Chowrasia in Kolkata and said that the murder of BJP worker is not a new thing and TMC would remove anyone who speaks against them. "One year after the elections when the Home Minister is coming, our worker has been murdered," Paul added.

364.title: Arvind Kejriwal is misusing his power: Bagga's mother on his arrest
364.article_body: The mother of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, who was arrested by Punjab Police, has accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of misusing his power. She said, "[Punjab Police] acted like 'hooligans', arrived in civil attire...took him away...They didn't even give time (to Bagga) to wear his turban." Bagga was arrested over his alleged threat to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal.

365.title: Man swallows jewellery worth ₹1.45 lakh along with biryani at Eid party in Chennai
365.article_body: A 32-year-old Chennai man allegedly swallowed jewellery worth ₹1.45 lakh before eating biryani at his fiancee's colleague's house during Eid party. Police said he confessed to swallowing the jewellery under the influence of alcohol, following which they took him to a hospital. He was reportedly given bananas and made to excrete the jewellery, which was handed over to the owner.

366.title: Malayalam actress Manju Warrier to star in Ajith Kumar's next: Report
366.article_body: Malayalam actress Manju Warrier has reportedly signed on to star opposite Ajith Kumar in his next film tentatively titled 'AK61'. According to reports, she will soon join the sets of the movie which is directed by H Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor. Notably, 'AK61' will be Manju Warrier's second Tamil film after Dhanush's 'Asuran'.

367.title: Reduce slavery to foreign goods, be vocal for local: PM Modi
367.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday urged citizens to reduce slavery to foreign goods and focus on the 'vocal for local' mantra. "Aatmanirbhar Bharat is our path as well as our resolve," Modi said while inaugurating the Jain International Trade Organisation's 'JITO Connect 2022' business meet. "We've to reduce dependence on foreign products. Find new destinations for export," he added.

368.title: Aus seeks 'strong friendship' with Solomon Islands despite China pact
368.article_body: Australian Defence Minister Peter Dutton said the country will continue having a "strong friendship" with the Solomon Islands despite it signing a security pact with China. Solomon Islands PM Manasseh Sogavare has been very clear that he isn't going to let China establish a military base on the islands and Australia is taking him at his word, Dutton added.

369.title: Govt orders all imported coal-based units to run at full capacity amid high demand
369.article_body: The government has invoked Section 11 of Electricity Act, mandating all imported coal-based power units to run at full capacity amid the ongoing power crisis in the country. "The demand for power has gone up by almost 20% in energy terms. The supply of domestic coal has increased but...it's not sufficient to meet increased demand for power," Power Ministry said.

370.title: 52-year-old Indian dies while trying to scale world's 3rd highest peak in Nepal
370.article_body: A 52-year-old Indian climber died near the summit of the world's third-highest peak Mount Kanchenjunga in Nepal on Thursday, the expedition's organisers have said. Narayanan Iyer breathed his last after collapsing at an altitude of 8,200 metres, they said. Two guides were assisting him in climbing, Pioneer Adventure's MD Nivesh Karki said.

371.title: Ram Charan's fans climb hotel walls to catch a glimpse of actor, video surfaces
371.article_body: Ram Charan was mobbed by fans upon his arrival in Visakhapatnam on Wednesday. A video of his fans climbing the walls of the hotel where the actor was staying to catch a glimpse of him has surfaced online. Charan reached Visakhapatnam to shoot for his upcoming project with Shankar. Tentatively titled 'RC 15', the film also stars Kiara Advani.

372.title: Adi Chopra turned floor of YRF into research wing: 'Prithviraj' director
372.article_body: The director of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi has stated that producer Aditya Chopra turned an entire floor of the Yash Raj Films office into a research wing for the film. "I had personally worked on the script from 2004 to 2019 updating...every year...We kept the research bay fully operational till the last day of the shoot," Chandraprakash said.

373.title: I try to unite whole India: Ayushmann on being pan-India face of legacy brands
373.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, speaking about being the pan-India face of legacy brands, stated that he has always tried to unite the whole of India through inclusive subjects and disruptive scripts and characters that challenge the status quo. "If I'm being viewed as someone who is contributing to sparking a dialogue...then I'm doing my job correctly," the actor said.

374.title: Person declared Indian once can't be declared foreigner later: Gauhati HC
374.article_body: A Foreigners' Tribunal bench of Gauhati High Court said that once the tribunal has declared a person to be an Indian, they cannot be declared a non-Indian if brought before it a second time. "A Foreigners' Tribunal only renders an opinion...it would be wrong to say that the Centre...would be bound by the opinion of the Tribunal," the court said.

375.title: Wristbands with caste identity not allowed in schools: TN's Theni District CEO
375.article_body: Chief Education Officer of Tamil Nadu's Theni ordered all school principals in the district to ensure coloured strings that indicate caste identity are not worn by the students. The order stated students will be severely punished if found inciting caste sectarianism. In April, a Tirunelveli student died after a clash with fellow students over wearing a wristband with caste identity.

376.title: Pune civic body may stop issuing new water connections: Official
376.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation plans to temporarily stop giving permission to new water connections to properties due to a water shortage, a PMC official said. "The...shortage...was expected due to...rising mercury levels and...expansion of city limits," the official added. "The situation would be reviewed by the end of this month and a final decision would be taken," the official further said.

377.title: Sonali repeats outfit she wore 16 yrs ago for an event with Pierce Brosnan, shares pics
377.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre, in an Instagram post, revealed that for Huma Qureshi's Eid party, she wore an outfit she first wore 16 years ago for an event with 'James Bond' actor Pierce Brosnan. "I wore this 16 years ago, during my first trimester," she wrote while sharing pictures. "Super happy that in this regard not much has changed," Sonali added.

378.title: Hotel shut after snake skin found in its newspaper wrapped food in Kerala
378.article_body: A hotel in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram has been temporarily shut after a customer allegedly found a part of a snake skin packed into her food. The snake skin was found in the newspaper that was used to pack the parottas, following which the food safety officials were alerted. The officials have also served a show-cause notice to the restaurant.

379.title: Pune man invests in fake forex trading firm, cheated of ₹21.66 lakh
379.article_body: A case has been filed after a 48-year-old man was cheated of ₹21.66 lakh by fraudsters who allegedly lured him into investing in a non-existent forex trading company, 'Tradeshotfx', in Pune. The complainant had come in contact with the accused through the internet and made the investments last year. The accused reportedly gave the complainant information showing profits he'd made.

380.title: Man seen duct-taped to plane seat in viral video jailed for groping crew's breasts in US
380.article_body: A passenger who was duct-taped to his seat for groping two flight attendants' breasts and punching one attendant mid-air has been jailed for 60 days in US' Ohio. A viral video of the incident showed the 23-year-old being bound to his seat on a Frontier Airlines flight. He was arrested by Miami Police after the plane landed.

381.title: Girl records video of father molesting her in Bihar to get him arrested; says 'he did it daily'
381.article_body: A girl has recorded a video of her father molesting her in Bihar's Samastipur to get him arrested. The girl, who said that her father allegedly "molested her daily", added that her mother held her responsible for the father's act. Police said that further investigation into the matter is underway.

382.title: Hardik would want to play at his best vs ex-team MI in IPL 2022: Gavaskar
382.article_body: Ahead of GT-MI in IPL 2022, Sunil Gavaskar said GT skipper Hardik Pandya would want to play at his best against MI as he wasn't retained by his ex-franchise in mega auction in February. "But he also owes so much to MI," he added. Gavaskar further said it won't be same as was the case for David Warner(92*) against SRH.

383.title: 2 dead after car hits motorbike in UP's Pratapgarh
383.article_body: Two people died while four others got injured after a car rammed into a motorbike in Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh on Friday. The two deceased, identified as Shailesh Kori (20) and Nirmala Devi (55), were going home on the bike when the accident took place, police said.  The car driver was allegedly under the influence of alcohol when detained, police said.

384.title: No ground for sedition against Maha MP Navneet Rana, husband Ravi Rana: Court
384.article_body: A court in Mumbai has said that there is no sufficient ground for invoking the charge of sedition against Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana. They have "undoubtedly crossed the line of freedom of speech", the court said. They were arrested after they announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence.

385.title: Fire breaks out at Calcutta High Court, no injuries reported
385.article_body: A minor fire broke out at a courtroom in Calcutta High Court around 10:45 am on Friday, police said. "Initially, there was a smell of burning electrical wires from the courtroom. It was evacuated immediately and the policemen posted there managed to douse the blaze," a police officer said. No injuries were reported in the incident.

386.title: Mrunal Thakur books 'Jersey' tickets for staff of coffee house in Mumbai
386.article_body: Mrunal Thakur recently visited a coffee house in Mumbai's Powai and booked tickets for her film 'Jersey' for the entire staff as a gesture for their hospitality. "The staff...was so sweet and generous in their hospitality and wished to see Jersey whenever they get time," the actress said, adding "It's incidents like these that...make me feel grateful."

387.title: Tomorrow's technology unveiled now with Ace EV: Tata Motors
387.article_body: Supported by the TATA UniEVerse and powered by the EVOGEN battery, the new Ace EV just got launched by Tata Motors. The company informed that the Ace EV is built for sustainable operations, reduced costs, and improved uptime through superior charging infrastructure, along with dedicated EV service and support centres.

388.title: B'luru sees rise in COVID containment zones as active cases cross 1,500
388.article_body: The number of containment zones in Bengaluru rose to nine on Thursday as active cases of coronavirus have crossed the 1,500-mark in the city. Mahadevpura has the most number of containment zones at four. The number of daily coronavirus cases recorded in Bengaluru Urban has increased in the past five days by nearly 83.9% to 171 on Thursday, data said.

389.title: WhatsApp working on feature to allow group admins to delete others' texts: Report
389.article_body: Meta owned WhatsApp is working on a new feature that will enable group admins to delete messages posted by other members on the group, as per a report. The move will reportedly enable admins to act as moderators of a group. Apart from this, WhatsApp is also working on extending the time to delete a message for everybody.

390.title: 398 kids rescued from Pune railway station, reunited with families
390.article_body: At least 398 children, who had run away from their homes, were rescued from the Pune railway station between April 2021 and March 2022, a report stated. Railways officials said that after counselling and help from the administration, the rescued children were reunited with their families and relatives. Out of the total children, 303 were boys, and 95 were girls.

391.title: 2 held in Punjab for alleged links with Khalistani terrorists
391.article_body: Two people were arrested from Punjab's Ferozepur and Faridkot districts for their alleged links with the four suspected Khalistani terrorists arrested on Thursday for carrying ammunition in Haryana's Karnal. The two suspects, identified as Akashdeep and Jashandeep, are accomplices of the four suspected terrorists linked to Pakistan-based Babbar Khalsa terrorist Harwinder Singh Rinda, police said.

392.title: Begged onlookers for help, no one came: Wife of man lynched by her relatives in Hyd
392.article_body: The Muslim wife of 25-year-old Hindu man Nagaraju who was allegedly lynched by her relatives on a busy road in Hyderabad said she had "begged and pleaded" onlookers for help. "The attack went on for 15-20 minutes, but no one helped," said Sulthana. "If the onlookers had helped, my husband would be alive today," she added.

393.title: Will Smith in therapy after Oscars slapping incident: Report
393.article_body: Actor Will Smith has been going to therapy after the 2022 Oscars slapping incident, reported Entertainment Tonight. The actor slapped comedian Chris Rock onstage after the latter made a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith's alopecia. Will had later apologised for the incident in an Instagram post. He made his first public appearance at Mumbai airport on April 23.

394.title: EV-charging hub set up at B'luru mall, 50 cars can be charged at one time
394.article_body: Fortum Charge & Drive India has commissioned a public electric vehicle (EV)-charging hub at Forum Neighbourhood Mall in Bengaluru. According to the company, the charging hub will cater to all types of electric cars and compatible three-and two-wheelers and can charge 50 cars at one time. The company is planning to set up 200 EV charging points across the city.

395.title: 1971 war finest example of whole-of-govt approach towards national security: Rajnath
395.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the 1971 Indo-Pakistani war was the finest example of the whole-of-government approach not only for armed forces but also for national security. Speaking at PC Lal Memorial Lecture, he said, "It's not always necessary to have more expensive weapon systems. It is the employment of weapon systems that gives us an edge in wars."

396.title: He could've got 6 runs in another over: Yuvraj on declaration when Sachin was on 194*
396.article_body: Talking about Rahul Dravid declaring India's innings against Pakistan in 2004 Multan Test when Sachin Tendulkar was batting on 194*(348), Yuvraj Singh said, "We got a message...that we had to play fast and we were going to declare." "He could have got those six runs in another over...I don't think another two overs would've made a difference," Yuvraj added.

397.title: He said 'That's not how cricket is played': Powell on offering Warner chance to hit 100
397.article_body: DC's Rovman Powell revealed that before the start of last over against SRH, he asked David Warner if he wanted a single to try to get a hundred. "Warner said, 'Listen...that's not how cricket is played. You should try to smack it as hard as...possible'," Powell said. Powell scored 18 runs in last over, while Warner remained unbeaten on 92.

398.title: Xiaomi allowed to operate seized assets worth ₹5,551 crore by K'taka HC
398.article_body: Karnataka High Court has stayed the ED's decision to seize ₹5,551.27 crore from Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's bank accounts for suspected violations of foreign exchange laws. The court has allowed Xiaomi to operate its seized accounts for day to day activities. The company earlier said its "royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legit and truthful".

399.title: Only 23 of India's 100 unicorn startups are profitable: Report
399.article_body: Only 23 of the 100 unicorns (startups with a valuation of $1 billion or above) in India have achieved profitability for a financial year, Moneycontrol reported citing data from Tracxn Technologies. These startups have raised over $80 billion from investors to date, it added. The list of profitable unicorn startups includes Zerodha, Nykaa, Zoho, Lenskart, CoinSwitch Kuber, Mamaearth and Shiprocket.

400.title: People ask ridiculous rapid-fire questions; what are we, teenagers? Radhika
400.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has stated that people ask "some ridiculous questions" during rapid-fire question and answer rounds. She was giving an interview which included a rapid-fire round. The actress added that there are questions like choosing between this person or that person. "You can't choose from two actors you've worked with. What is this, what are we, teenagers?" she said.
